lead_paragraph: The new disagreement revolves around the lingering question of who gets to represent the opposition delegation.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

snippet: The new disagreement revolves around the lingering question of who gets to represent the opposition delegation.

headline.main: Dispute Over Opposition’s Seat at Table Threatens to Push Back Syria Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Dispute Over Opposition’s Seat at Table Threatens to Push Back Syria Peace Talks

abstract: Disagreement over who will represent opposition in Syrian conflict is still rampant days before world leaders convene in Geneva for peace talks; United Nations Security Council, which had proposed road map to cease-fire, moves to prioritize survival of hundreds of thousands of civilians in besieged towns.
